docs.lead_paragraph: Bruce Kison, an injury-plagued pitcher, has reached agreement with the Boston Red Sox, and his decision marks the second time that he has spurned the Yankees as a free agent. A Yankee source said yesterday that George Steinbrenner, owner of the Yankees, had been interested in signing the 35-year-old Kison, just as Steinbrenner had been interested five years ago when Kison was a free agent the first time.

docs.lead_paragraph: BOSTON W HEN Jim Rice considers the current plight of the Boston Red Sox, he is hard-pressed to list any positive things that have happened this season and is forced to cast back a half- dozen years for the source of the negative things. ''I don't think there are too many plusses right now,'' said Rice, one of many struggling Red Sox players who will face another struggling team, the Yankees, at the Stadium beginning tonight. ''As for the minuses, you have to go back about six years, because that's when everything started happening.''

docs.lead_paragraph: Carl Yastrzemski, who inherited the Red Sox left- field job from Ted Williams 23 years ago, said goodbye today in a 58- minute pregame ''Yaz Day'' celebration at Fenway Park. Yastrzemski, who will retire Sunday after his 3,008th game, the most ever played by a major leaguer, ended the festivities with a dramatic and emotional trot round the playing field during which he shook hands with fans and waved to the sellout crowd of 33,491. ''I always tried to control myself over the years,'' said Yastrzemski after the ceremony. ''I always tried not to show emotion, just block everything out. I was trying to show today that, deep down inside, I'm as emotional as anybody.''

docs.lead_paragraph: Outfielder Troy O'Leary and the Boston Red Sox agreed yesterday to a four-year, $14.8 million contract, avoiding a salary arbitration hearing that was scheduled for next week. O'Leary, who made $1.1 million last year, gets $2.4 million this season, $3.5 million in 1999, $4 million in 2000 and $4.6 million in 2001. Boston has a $5.35 million option for 2002 and must pay a $300,000 buyout if it is not exercised.
